comments.body: you have it after fontStyle everywhere but here
Yeah, the order of the fields is different in TextStyle and ui.TextStyle.  I've matched the callee order in each case.
just above the "See also" above, it would be good to continue the story showing what name it ends up being exposed as, and how you refer to it from TextStyle.
heh, one day we should figure out how to lerp Paints!

comments.body: This should probably be under a Sample Code heading so the analyzer picks it up and checks it.

Should the other TextStyle examples also be a {@tool sample}? The current docs just has the first two complete examples as formal samples, and the TextStyle-only snippets are left as snippets. (see https://docs.flutter.io/flutter/painting/TextStyle-class.html)
There should be an explanation of how to use this here and in the TextStyle class docs. It is not immediately obvious from this short description

Added some more info.  This property's docs will link to the `ui.FontFeature` docs, which offer a more complete explanation:
    https://github.com/flutter/engine/blob/master/lib/ui/text.dart#L106
I guess that is ok since this feature is only likely to be used by more advanced users. Fully exposing docs here may add clutter and make it harder to find the more commonly used properties.
I'm not sure how this will look inside the sample snippet with an image embedded in between text. Have you generated the docs locally to check?
Missed this line in the original PR.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +843,847 @@      letterSpacing: letterSpacing == null ? null : letterSpacing * letterSpacingFactor + letterSpacingDelta,
      wordSpacing: wordSpacing == null ? null : wordSpacing * wordSpacingFactor + wordSpacingDelta,
      textBaseline: textBaseline ?? this.textBaseline,
      height: height == null ? null : height * heightFactor + heightDelta,
      locale: locale ?? this.locale,
